Name: Statue of Baboon with Cartouches of Ramesses the Third
Description: The baboon, the sacred animal of the god of wisdom, Thoth, is sitting on a base with his hands on his knees; a pectoral adorns his chest. Only the two cavities of the eyes can be seen and the rest of the face is sculpted as a square block representing the mouth and nose. The base is adorned on the top by the winged solar disk; below are two names of Ramesses the Third.
